lines.text: I like cheap. Just shovel that shit out and hope the masses eat it. Okay, no reason not to start right away.
Remember: when selling cheap, it's all about turnover. Like a rotisserie. Like... never mind.
The cheap strategy is what we call 'penetration pricing' in MBA-speak. Yes, that's a real term. I didn't make it up.
Volume! Volume! That's the ticket! Sell enough cheap Things and eventually we're rich. That's basic math. I think.
You know what cheap Things remind me of? Hot dogs at a baseball game. Overpriced, but people buy them anyway. Wait, that's the opposite.
The margins are thin, but so am I. I'm a hot dog. That's not relevant. Keep clicking.
Marketing cheap Things is easy: just tell everyone they're cheap! It's called 'value proposition.' I learned that at business school.
